HubSpot should start paying you for support. Anyway, here's my question. I saw that there are 2 placements for the actions. there is an action on each card. So let's say you have a CRM card built on social media post engagements, and each new card is about each new post. So there is an action there. But there is also an action on the entire CRM card system at the bottom.

I'm looking into the latter. How can I create this and add more than 1 action option?

So real quick just to clarify with you, there are 2 places you can put a custom crm card in HubSpot (using dev projects or react crm cards). First is the middle pane (it's where the activities and overview tab sit, you can get a custom tab though if you have a crm card) the next spot is the classic right hand bar.
CRM cards are only supported on classic object pages though (contact, deals, companies, custom etc), they aren't currently support on media post engagements to my knowledge.
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> would be able to tell you more about the support object (now and in the future)
i'm placing CRM cards on company pages
my crm card pulls in information from third party platforms, links it to a company, and displays it as a crm card
This message contains interactive elements.

<@U7QHZR9DZ> It's a little confusing... a custom workflow action is written in Node.JS or Python, right? And this looks like JSON... your log seems to suggest it went well but...

Normally in Node.JS my callback to an output field looks like this:

```callback({
    outputFields: {
      nextReplyTimeDueDate: dueDatetimeUnix,
    },
  });```
followed by a Data output defined in the action (below the code) where the name is equal to the key, so *nextReplyTimeDueDate* in this example (see screenshot). This last step makes the data available to any following actions in the workflow.
Ah yeah now I know what you mean, yes you can put multiple actions in that actions button at the bottom
Just a PSA though, those are legacy CRM cards, so you'll definitely want to build with developer project based cards (which are much more flexible and you can still built out this project with them)
how do i fo that?
this is part of an app
Ah yeah so project based cards are a per portal thing for now, so you might be best using the legacy ones
thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
ok, so how do i put multiple actions on the legacy crm cards?
and do you know when dev projects are going to be integrated into apps?

• To add multiple actions see use the `primaryAction`: The primary action for a record type, typically a "creation" action. See <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards#action-types|action types> for details on specifying actions. This property is optional.
• `secondaryActions`: A list of actions displayed on the card level. See <https://developers-HubSpot-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/docs-beta/crm/extensions?hs_preview=NdXihRvX-27422303162#action-types|action types> for details on specifying actions. This property is optional.
the primaryAction and secondaryActions are things you send in your response webhook
there are 3 different action types: Iframes, Action Hooks, Confirmation
(actions in the primary and secondary props, are the same as they are in the result[].actions props)

it looks like to me from <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards#action-types>

that there are actions that are in each card record sent as part of result[].actions. and then there are settingsAction and secondaryActions, which I'm still not quite sure what they are,
correct
The primary action in this example is the Create Ticket
ok so create ticket is primary action
secondary action is whatever is under Actions
the secondaryActions in the Actions dropdown
what are settings actions

ok, so in the developer portal, under the app, in the crm card features, and then in the CRM card name there is something called custom actions, what is this?

Hello everyone! I was wondering if it's possible to utilize "scheduling pages" (which are similar to Calendly) using the meetings API. Currently, I can create meetings through the API, but they aren't associated with any specific "scheduling page"
those are for the actions that you define in the CRM card response

say for example you have a primary action for creating a ticket (like the example above), and you want to call the endpoint: <https://createticket.com> then you need to define that in the custom actions urls so that you're app can access it
If you go to the webhooks tab, you'll see the code behind that example. The primary action includes a uri, with the endpoint already there.
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1688564508285619?thread_ts=1676211657.358389&cid=C2YHAHB6K>
correct
so...what's the point of the custom actions section then?
you have to define it for security reasons
just so that someone can't intercept the request and sent someone to a different iframe
(it's dumb)
do i need each endpoint there, or just the domain?
it should be just the domain
that doesn't really solve the security issue?
yep just base domains
FYI these docs are sometimes better: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#action-types>
I know, but they are very difficult to read
truth
you hit the nail on the head
